Query.SqlString: SELECT Top 32767 ID,Literature FROM Literature WHERE (Literature ='SSTH00')

BibliographicData.Title: Connections between anterior inferotemporal cortex and superior temporal sulcus in the macaque monkey.

Reference.Quotation: "The injection sites in the TEad cases were located at the middle between the lower lip of STS and the lateral lip of the anterior middle temporal sulcus (Figs. 2A, 3-5),... . ...The PHA-L injections were circumscribed to small foci, which were 0.5-1.0 mm in width in the plane parallel to cortical layers.They included all cortical layers, except in one TEad case (Fig. 5, case 3) in which the injection was restricted to layers 3-6."
Reference.Comments: Photomicrographs illustratings for the PHA-L injection sites, see Saleem and Tanaka (1996), their figure 6.

Reference.Quotation: "The distribution of labelling in case 3 (Fig. 5) constituted a single cluster elongated rostrocaudally. This cluster in case 3 was located laterally closer to the upper lip of STS and seems to cover parts of both TPO and Taa." p. 5091

"...whereas the injection sites in the TEav cases were located at the medial lip of the anterior middle temporal sulcus (Figs. 2B, 8-11). ...The PHA-L injections were circumscribed to small foci, which were 0.5-1.0 mm in width in the plane parallel to the cortical layers. They included all of the cortical layers, except in one TEad case (Fig. 5, case 3) in which the injection was restricted to layers 3-6."
Reference.Comments: Photomicrographs illustratings for the PHA-L injection sites, see Saleem and Tanaka (1996), their figure 6.

Reference.Quotation: "True of all five TEav injections cases, the distribution of labeling in STS was limited to the lower bank and fundus of the rostral half of the sulcus. No labeling was found in the more caudal parts of STS." p. 5094

TracerSubstance.FullName: Horseradish peroxidase, conjugated to wheat germ agglutinin

Reference.Quotation: "In the case in which WGA-HRP was injected into the caudal part of area 36 (Figs. 2D, 14), the injection covered the lateral lip of the rhinal sulcus, and its latera border was -1.5 mm medial to the Teav/36 border." p. 5088

"In the area 36 case there were again several clusters of labeling in the lower bank of the rostral STS as in the TEav and TEav/36 border cases, but there was also a distinctive cluster of labeling in the upper bank of the rostral end of STS (Fig. 14,section 99)." pp. 5095-5096

"The injection sites in the TEad cases were located at the lip of the anterior middle temporal sulcus (Figs. 2A, 3-5), ... .The WGA-HRP injections were larger (1.5-3.0 mm in width) and included all cortical layers."

In all three TEad injections cases, the labelling in STS was mainly found in two groups of clusters; one in the upper bank of the rostral STS and the other in the lower bank and the fundus of the rostrocaudally middle part of STS." p. 5089

In all three TEad injections cases, the labelling in STS was mainly found in two groups of clusters; one in the upper bank of the rostral STS and the other in the lower bank and the fundus of the rostrocaudally middle part of STS. ...In the WGA-HRP cases, the distribution of retrogradely labeled cell bodies roughly coincided with that of anterogradely labeled terminals in the plane parallel to the cortical surface." (p. 5089)

In all three TEad injections cases, the labelling in STS was mainly found in two groups of clusters; one in the upper bank of the rostral STS and the other in the lower bank and the fundus of the rostrocaudally middle part of STS. ...In the WGA-HRP cases, the distribution of retrogradely labeled cell bodies roughly coincided with that of anterogradely labeled terminals in the plane parallel to the cortical surface." (p. 5089)

"The injection sites in the TEad cases were located at the lip of the anterior middle temporal sulcus (Figs. 2A, 3-5), ... .The WGA-HRP injections were larger (1.5-3.0 mm in width) and included all cortical layers."

In all three Tead injections cases, the labelling in STS was mainly found in two groups of clusters; one in the upper bank of the rostral STS and the other in the lower bank and the fundus of the rostrocaudally middle part of STS. ...In the WGA-HRP cases, the distribution of retrogradely labeled cell bodies roughly coincided with that of anterogradely labeled terminals in the plane parallel to the cortical surface." p. 5089

In all three Tead injections cases, the labelling in STS was mainly found in two groups of clusters; one in the upper bank of the rostral STS and the other in the lower bank and the fundus of the rostrocaudally middle part of STS. ...In the WGA-HRP cases, the distribution of retrogradely labeled cell bodies roughly coincided with that of anterogradely labeled terminals in the plane parallel to the cortical surface." p. 5089

"...whereas the injections sites in the Teav cases were located at the medial lip of the anterior middle temporal sulcus (Fig. 2B, 8-11).The WGA-HRP injections were larger (1.5-3.0 mm in width) and included all cortical layers." pp. 5087-5088

"In the cases in which WGA-HRP was injected at the border between Teav and area 36 (Figs. 2C, 13; Teav/36 border case), the injection did not cover the medial part of area 36 located within the rhinal sulcus." pp. 5087-5088

"In the TEav/36 border injection case , the distribution of labeling was confined to the lower bank of the rostral STS (Fig. 13), as in the TEav cases. The distribution of labeling was split into several small clusters with an overall rostrocaudal extent similar to that of large clusters in case 4 (Fig. 8) and case 8 with TEav injections, exept there was one cluster in TG in the TEav/36 case." p. 5095
